CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 2, 1955, pg. 21, reads: "MARBLES CHAMP HAILED - A goodly crowd turned out at City and County Building Monday to pay tribute to Raymond Jones Jr., 12, of 1015 North Franklin Street, who was crowned U. S. marbles champion by Mayor David L. Lawrence. Raymond won the national title at Asbury Park, N. J., last week.  Seated, left to right, with the new champ, are Mayor Lawrence and Mr. and Mrs. Raymond Jones, Sr., the boy's parents.  At the left is Councilman Paul F. Jones, talking to one of his colleagues. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Pittsburgh Mayor David L. Lawrence, 1955 national marbles champion Raymond Jones Jr., and Mrs. and Mr. Raymond Jones Sr., seated on folding chairs, with Paul F. Jones on left in background, outside of City County Building
